message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the communication infrastructure required for the implementation of the smart grid, which involves the use of wired and wireless technologies. This makes cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) the most likely category. The paper also discusses the need for a secure communication infrastructure, which falls under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The smart grid is a complex system that involves control and automation, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) another likely category. The paper also discusses the design of efficient and robust network architecture, which falls under cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the paper proposes an end-to-end communication architecture for different types of networks, which falls under cs.CY (Computers and Society).
